verses.kjv: Now it came to pass, as David sat in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, Lo, I dwell in an house of cedars, but the ark of the covenant of the LORD remaineth under curtains.
verses.web: When David lived in his house, David said to Nathan the prophet, “Behold, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of LORD’s covenant is in a tent.”
verses.ct: One day, while David was settled in his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet, "Look — I'm living in a house built with cedar, but the ark of the LORD's covenant is sitting under a tent."

verses.kjv: Then Nathan said unto David, Do all that is in thine heart; for God is with thee.
verses.web: Nathan said to David, “Do all that is in your heart; for God is with you.”
verses.ct: Nathan replied, "Do whatever is on your heart. God is with you."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass the same night, that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
verses.web: That same night, the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
verses.ct: But that same night, the word of God came to Nathan:

verses.kjv: Go and tell David my servant, Thus saith the LORD, Thou shalt not build me an house to dwell in:
verses.web: “Go and tell David my servant, ‘LORD says, “You shall not build me a house to dwell in;
verses.ct: "Go and tell my servant David, 'This is what the LORD says: You are not the one who will build me a house to live in.

verses.kjv: For I have not dwelt in an house since the day that I brought up Israel unto this day; but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another.
verses.web: for I have not lived in a house since the day that I brought up Israel to this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tent to another.
verses.ct: I have never lived in a house — not from the day I brought Israel out of Egypt until now. I've moved from tent to tent, from one dwelling place to another.

verses.kjv: Wheresoever I have walked with all Israel, spake I a word to any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people, saying, Why have ye not built me an house of cedars?
verses.web: In all places in which I have walked with all Israel, did I speak a word with any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to be shepherd of my people, saying, ‘Why have you not built me a house of cedar?’ ” ’
verses.ct: In all the places I traveled with Israel, did I ever say to any of the judges I appointed to shepherd my people, "Why haven't you built me a house of cedar?"'

verses.kjv: Now therefore thus shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote, even from following the sheep, that thou shouldest be ruler over my people Israel:
verses.web: “Now therefore, you shall tell my servant David, ‘LORD of Armies says, “I took you from the sheep pen, from following the sheep, to be prince over my people Israel.
verses.ct: "Now tell my servant David, 'The LORD of hosts says: I took you from the pasture, from following sheep, to be the ruler over my people Israel.

verses.kjv: And I have been with thee whithersoever thou hast walked, and have cut off all thine enemies from before thee, and have made thee a name like the name of the great men that are in the earth.
verses.web: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and have cut off all your enemies from before you. I will make you a name like the name of the great ones who are in the earth.
verses.ct: I have been with you everywhere you've gone. I destroyed all your enemies before you. And I will make your name as famous as the greatest people on earth.

verses.kjv: Also I will ordain a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, and they shall dwell in their place, and shall be moved no more; neither shall the children of wickedness waste them any more, as at the beginning,
verses.web: I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in their own place, and be moved no more. The children of wickedness will not waste them any more, as at the first,
verses.ct: I will establish a homeland for my people Israel and plant them there so they can live in peace and never be uprooted again. Wicked nations will no longer oppress them the way they did in the past,

verses.kjv: And since the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. Moreover I will subdue all thine enemies. Furthermore I tell thee that the LORD will build thee an house.
verses.web: and from the day that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. I will subdue all your enemies. Moreover I tell you that LORD will build you a house.
verses.ct: as they have since the time I appointed judges over my people Israel. I will crush all your enemies. And beyond that, I'm telling you: the LORD will build a dynasty for you.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when thy days be expired that thou must go to be with thy fathers, that I will raise up thy seed after thee, which shall be of thy sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
verses.web: It will happen, when your days are fulfilled that you must go to be with your fathers, that I will set up your offspring after you, who will be of your sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
verses.ct: When your life comes to an end and you join your ancestors, I will raise up one of your own sons to succeed you, and I will establish his kingdom.

verses.kjv: He shall build me an house, and I will stablish his throne for ever.
verses.web: He will build me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.
verses.ct: He is the one who will build a house for me, and I will make his throne last forever.

verses.kjv: I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee:
verses.web: I will be his father, and he will be my son. I will not take my loving kindness away from him, as I took it from him that was before you;
verses.ct: I will be his father, and he will be my son. I will never take my mercy away from him the way I took it from the one who ruled before you.

verses.kjv: But I will settle him in mine house and in my kingdom for ever: and his throne shall be established for evermore.
verses.web: but I will settle him in my house and in my kingdom forever. His throne will be established forever.” ’ ”
verses.ct: I will set him over my house and my kingdom forever, and his throne will stand for all time.'"

verses.kjv: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.
verses.web: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so Nathan spoke to David.
verses.ct: Nathan told David everything — every word and every detail of this vision.

verses.kjv: And David the king came and sat before the LORD, and said, Who am I, O LORD God, and what is mine house, that thou hast brought me hitherto?
verses.web: Then David the king went in, and sat before LORD; and he said, “Who am I, LORD God, and what is my house, that you have brought me this far?
verses.ct: Then King David went in and sat before the LORD. He prayed, "Who am I, LORD God, and what is my family, that you have brought me this far?

verses.kjv: And yet this was a small thing in thine eyes, O God; for thou hast also spoken of thy servant’s house for a great while to come, and hast regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O LORD God.
verses.web: This was a small thing in your eyes, God; but you have spoken of your servant’s house for a great while to come, and have respected me according to the standard of a man of high degree, LORD God.
verses.ct: And as if that weren't enough, God, you have also spoken about the future of your servant's family for generations to come. You have treated me as though I were the most important man alive, LORD God.

verses.kjv: What can David speak more to thee for the honour of thy servant? for thou knowest thy servant.
verses.web: What can David say yet more to you concerning the honor which is done to your servant? For you know your servant.
verses.ct: What more can David possibly say to you about the honor you've given your servant? You already know me completely.

verses.kjv: O LORD, for thy servant’s sake, and according to thine own heart, hast thou done all this greatness, in making known all these great things.
verses.web: LORD, for your servant’s sake, and according to your own heart, you have done all this greatness, to make known all these great things.
verses.ct: LORD, you have done all these incredible things for your servant's sake, and because it was your desire, revealing these great promises.

verses.kjv: O LORD, there is none like thee, neither is there any God beside thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.web: LORD, there is no one like you, neither is there any God besides you, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.ct: LORD, there is no one like you. There is no God besides you — that's what we've always known and heard.

verses.kjv: And what one nation in the earth is like thy people Israel, whom God went to redeem to be his own people, to make thee a name of greatness and terribleness, by driving out nations from before thy people, whom thou hast redeemed out of Egypt?
verses.web: What one nation in the earth is like your people Israel, whom God went to redeem to himself for a people, to make you a name by great and awesome things, in driving out nations from before your people, whom you redeem out of Egypt?
verses.ct: And what nation on earth is like your people Israel? You, God, went out to redeem them as your own people, making a name for yourself through great and awesome deeds — driving out nations before your people, the ones you rescued from Egypt.

verses.kjv: For thy people Israel didst thou make thine own people for ever; and thou, LORD, becamest their God.
verses.web: For you made your people Israel your own people forever; and you, LORD, became their God.
verses.ct: You made Israel your own people forever, and you, LORD, became their God.

verses.kjv: Therefore now, LORD, let the thing that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant and concerning his house be established for ever, and do as thou hast said.
verses.web: Now, LORD, let the word that you have spoken concerning your servant, and concerning his house, be established forever, and do as you have spoken.
verses.ct: So now, LORD, let the promise you made about your servant and his family stand forever. Do exactly what you said.

verses.kjv: Let it even be established, that thy name may be magnified for ever, saying, The LORD of hosts is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel: and let the house of David thy servant be established before thee.
verses.web: Let your name be established and magnified forever, saying, ‘LORD of Armies is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel. The house of David your servant is established before you.’
verses.ct: Let it be established so that your name will be honored forever, and people will say, 'The LORD of hosts is the God of Israel — he is God to Israel.' And let the dynasty of your servant David be established before you.

verses.kjv: For thou, O my God, hast told thy servant that thou wilt build him an house: therefore thy servant hath found in his heart to pray before thee.
verses.web: For you, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build him a house. Therefore your servant has found courage to pray before you.
verses.ct: You, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build a dynasty for him. That is why your servant has found the courage to pray this prayer before you.

verses.kjv: And now, LORD, thou art God, and hast promised this goodness unto thy servant:
verses.web: Now, LORD, you are God, and have promised this good thing to your servant.
verses.ct: LORD, you are God, and you have promised this wonderful thing to your servant.

verses.kjv: Now therefore let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may be before thee for ever: for thou blessest, O LORD, and it shall be blessed for ever.
verses.web: Now it has pleased you to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue forever before you; for you, LORD, have blessed, and it is blessed forever.”
verses.ct: Now may it please you to bless your servant's family so that it will continue before you forever. For when you bless something, LORD, it is blessed forever."
